entries.content: When a prospect asks a question, don't just answer it. Ask 'What do you mean?' or 'Why do you ask?' to understand the motivation behind the question.
entries.notes: Used to uncover underlying concerns or gather context before responding, preventing assumptions.

entries.content: Prospect: 'Have you ever worked with an insurance company before?' Sales Agent: 'Well, what do you mean?' This prompts the prospect to reveal their real concern (niche/regulated industry).
Use conditional questions to test the validity of an objection or gauge commitment. Frame it as 'If X were true, would Y still be a problem?'
entries.notes: Helps isolate the real issue and forces the prospect to consider if the stated objection is the *only* barrier.

entries.content: After prospect reveals concern about insurance experience: 'So you're telling me then that if you genuinely believed what I did could help you sell more, we can't work together if I have no insurance experience?'
entries.notes: This conditional question got the prospect to admit lack of sector experience wouldn't be a problem if they believed the solution worked.

focus_area: Handling "Think About It": "What specifically?", Conditional closing
